Fernando Galindo Ayuda

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/5594937375394672
  • Última atualização do currículo em 13/02/2018

Chair of Philosophy of Law in the University of Zaragoza. From 1982 Professor Titular of Philosophy of Law. Teaching on Philosophy of Law, Law and Computers and Ethics and legislation for engineers in the University of Zaragoza. From 1986 until today responsible of postgraduate courses of Law and Computers for Spanish, European and Iberoamerican jurists. From 1997 spanish responsible of the European Universities Legal Informatics Study Programme" EULISP Diplom. The Diplom is imparted by the Universities of: Bologna, Glasgow (Strathclyde), Hannover, London (Queen Mary and Westfield College), Leuven (K.U.), Namur, Oslo, Rovaniemi, Stockolm, Vienna and Zaragoza Fom 1999 coordinator of the Programme Legal framework for the information society (LEFIS), supported by the European Union, Socrates Programme Curriculum Development Advanced action. Countries and Universities participating in the Programme are: Austria, Linz and Vienna; Belgium, Louvain and Namur; Finland, Rovaniemi and Vaasa; Germany, Hanover and Münster; Italy, Bologna; Lithuania, Vilnius Law University; Netherlands, Rotterdam; Poland, Torun and Wroclaw; Spain, Burgos and Zaragoza; United Kingdom, Queen's University of Belfast and Warwick From 1984 responsible of researches and advice for Public Administrations, Judicial Power and Industry on Law and Computers. Most important topics: Legal databases and Artificial Intelligence (1984-1994), Computers, Communications and Public Administrations (1994-96), Regulation of digital signature (from 1997), regulation of Smart Cities. Joint researches in 1992-93 with the University of Linz (Austria) and in 1995-96 with the Queen´s University of Belfast (North Ireland). Between 1997 and 1998 responsible of the project AEQUITAS: Study of the legality of encrypted electronic messages, signed by digital signature and certificated by a third trusted party (TTP) as proof of evidence in criminal litigation, call INFOSEC 1996,DG XIII European Union. Participant in the AEQUITAS II Project (2001-2003), whose full title was Trust frame for electronic documents exchange between European judicial operators, and it s financed by the General Directorate XIII of the European Commission (IST-2000-29569). The general objective of the project was to speed up the procedures and to increase the effectiveness of the quality service that the judicial operators, specially Registrars and Attorneys render to the society, though the use of secure and confidential Internet communications. Legal adviser (from 1997) on the activities of the providers of certification services SISCER and FESTE. Author, editor and co-editor of 14 books, 64 chapters of books and 82 journals articles Author of the book: "Derecho e Informática", Madrid, La Ley-Actualidad, 1999 Co-organiser in October of 1995 of the first meeting on "Cryptography, privacy and computer auto-determination", Faculty of Law and School of Engineering of the University of Zaragoza. Co-chairman of the conference: "Advances in electronic Government", co-organized with the International Federation of Information Processing (IFIP), Zaragoza 10-11 February 2000 Co-founder in November of 1997 of the "Foundation for the study of the security of the telecommunications" (FESTE). FESTE was integrated by the spanish General Council of the Notaries, General Council of the "Corredores de Comercio" and General Council of Lawyers (1997-2005). President of the Association for the Promotion of the Information Technologies and the Electronic Commerce (APTICE). APTICE was (between April 2000 and December 2011). a non profit association that had as principal object the creation of a Stamp of Guarantee of the Electronic Commerce (AGACE). Founders of APTICE are Telecommunications industries, Banks, Portals and Government. . Invited lecturer, referee of scientific conferences, journals and research programmes, and panellist. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Linhas de pesquisa
Consequences of the juridical and political ideas.- Science of Law.- Policies.


Linhas de pesquisa
1.
Consequences of the juridical and political ideas.- Science of Law.- Policies.
Objetivo: Consequences of the juridical and political ideas.- The activities developed , whose realization is expressed in publications, focused initially on the study of the projection and scope of legal ideas implanted in the beginnings of liberalism in Spain (1808-1814) . He then took up the study of those contained in the Spanish Constitution of 1978. Since the enactment of this rules he studied the characteristics and consequences of the juridical and political ideas in the process of implementation of the Constitution and regulations by the processes carried out by lawyers who perform their work primarily in judicial and administrative institutions Science of Law.- The expansion produced by legal ideas at times considered present in the preparation of proposals aimed at changing the fundamentals and practices of Dogmatic or Science of Law and the Philosophy of Law, it is another object of the work of Galindo. The data indicated that both: Dogmatic and Philosophy , are needed to deal with the study of proper legal action methods of lawyers for each case and context specific action, rather than generic update or integration of the same around the dilemma Natural Law - Positive Law. Policies.- Another object of interest is to put policy-setting concrete action from the ideological pluralism , that is, from the principles of democracy , freedom of expression , privacy of communications , legal certainty and guarantee of public faith . These activities have brought consequently the contribution of different proposals from different policies, on regulations implementing the Information Technology and Communication as the life requires in every day..
Grande área: Ciências Sociais Aplicadas
Setores de atividade: Atividades jurídicas, de contabilidade e de auditoria.
Palavras-chave: Consequences of the juridical and political ideas; Science of Law; Communicative concept of Law; Policies.


Projetos de pesquisa
2017 - Atual
Fundamental rights review of EU data collection instruments and Programmes
Descrição: To establish and support an independent expert group to carry out fundamental rights review of any existing EU legislation, instrument or agreement with third parties that involves the collection, retention, storage or transfer of personal data.The service will be a pilot project shall support the activities of an independent group of experts responsible for reviewing the compliance of EU data collection instruments and mechanisms with the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights, with particular attention being paid to the application of the proportionality principle and to an assessment of existent relevant safeguards for the fundamental rights to privacy and the protection of personal data. As part of its activities, the expert group would also carry out the review of existing EU acts on data protection for police and criminal justice authorities and assess the need to align them with the Police Directive..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Fernando Galindo Ayuda - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): DIRECTORATE-GENERAL FOR JUSTICE AND CONSUMERS - Remuneração.
2016 - Atual
POSIBILIDADES Y REQUISITOS DE LOS SISTEMAS DE ORGANIZACION DEL CONOCIMIENTO PARA LA INTEROPERABILIDAD ENTRE LAS INSTITUCIONES DE LA MEMORIA Y EL SECTOR DEL TURISMO CULTURAL.
Descrição: Los sistemas de organización del conocimiento en red, en particular los tesauros a raíz de su relanzamiento mediante la norma ISO 25964, ofrecen grandes posibilidades para la interconexión sencilla, flexible, dinámica y distribuida de las instituciones de la memoria ? bibliotecas, archivos, museos, centros de documentación, instituciones de investigación en humanidades y ciencias sociales digitales, portales sobre transparencia?? con la creciente demanda del sector turístico por una experiencia personalizada y contextualizada, capaz de marcar diferencias en un mercado cada vez más competitivo, en el que nuestro país y sus comunidades se encuentran, por otra parte, extraordinariamente posicionadas por su riqueza cultural y documental y por su competente infraestructura turística, utilizada reiteradamente por personas de diferentes nacionalidades, lenguajes y culturas. El proyecto trata de colaborar desde el campo de las arquitecturas del conocimiento en la propuesta de líneas de acción para retroalimentar ambos sectores -el del patrimonio cultural y el turístico-: por un lado, facilitando la utilización de la ingente cantidad de datos y artefactos digitales disponibles gracias al trabajo de los profesionales de la información y la comunicación, humanistas y los científicos sociales, susceptibles de permitir la contextualización, enriquecimiento y personalización de la experiencia turística en relación con los objetos culturales; y por el otro, recíprocamente, buscando estrategias para propiciar la transferencia de recursos desde la industria hacia el sector de la investigación básica en humanidades y ciencias sociales, favoreciendo la sostenibilidad económica de la investigación básica sobre la cultura y el territorio al conectarla con sus usos potenciales con valor de mercado. Aunque el tratamiento se centra en el análisis de los sistemas de organización del conocimiento en red, se abordan también las cuestiones legales (protección de datos y propiedades intelectual e industrial, básicamente), comunicaciones (seguridad de las comunicaciones, efectividad del mensaje informativo) y de tratamiento masivo de datos (?privacy by design?, uso de algoritmos respetuosos con las reglas del mercado y la puesta en práctica en el uso de los datos abiertos de la normativa sobre derechos humanos) que resultan esenciales para una contextualización operativa. Para ello, se cuenta con un equipo interdisciplinar, formado por un grupo de investigadores con una sólida trayectoria en análisis cultural, legal, informativo-documental, periodístico, estadístico y lógico-matemático, que utilizarán el proyecto Infogoya (goya.unizar.es), un proyecto del grupo visitado de más de 3.300 páginas y con más de 130.000 visitantes únicos al año, como banco de pruebas; y, a partir de él, realizarán un prototipo ex novo para el Camino de Santiago.
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Fernando Galindo Ayuda - Integrante / Pilar Lasala - Integrante / Javier Garcia - Coordenador / Manuel Vázquez - Integrante / Joaquin López del Ramo - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Comisión Interministerial de Ciencia y Tecnología - Bolsa.
2012 - 2013
Monitoring of e-government : improvements
Descrição: Improved participation in the knowledge society through the work of the Observatory of e-government. Political, economic and empirical aspects.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
